title: Home Office Business Use

scenario_info.name: Home Office Business Use
scenario_info.description: Daniel works from home and has used 15% of his home exclusively for his photography business for the past 6 years. When he sells the property, the business-use portion is not eligible for the full main residence exemption under the interest deductibility test.

expected_result.notes: After 50% CGT discount. 11.67% taxable (15% floor area x 77.79% time).

applicable_rules: Part of home used for income-producing purposes (business)
Taxable proportion = Floor area % x Time proportion
Business use of 15% for 77.79% of ownership = 11.67% taxable
ITAA97 s115.25: 50% CGT discount applies to taxable portion
Note: Different from Airbnb room rental - this is exclusive business use

property_history.description: Started home photography business. 15% of floor area used exclusively for business. Interest deductibility test now applies to this portion.

properties.notes: Partial exemption (88.33%). Business use of 15% floor area for 7 years (77.79% of 9-year ownership). Taxable portion = 15% x 77.79% = 11.67%. Capital gain $223,000. Taxable: $26,024. After 50% discount: $13,012.

user_query: I've used 15% of my home exclusively for my photography business for the past 7 years. I've claimed deductions for that portion. Now I'm selling. What's my CGT position?
